intro: Notoseris rhombiformis, commonly known as the rhombic notoseris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellowish to orange flowers arranged in dense clusters, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to the arid environments it inhabits. Notoseris rhombiformis is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
